intro: Draba dubia subsp. dubia, commonly known as the alpine mouse-ear cress, is a low-growing perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It typically reaches heights of 5–15 cm and is characterized by its rosette of basal leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in early spring, often before the leaves fully expand. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, alpine environments. Draba dubia subsp. dubia is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops and weeds.
